intro: Amberboa hochstetteri, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture. Amberboa hochstetteri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
